title: Geographical Knowledge and Imperial Culture After the end of the Long War and the Jalali rebellions in particular, the Ottoman court continued to pursue the imperial tradition of offering patronage to authors of geographical works. From the second half of the seventeenth century on, the number of textual expressions of geography steadily increased in the Ottoman Empire.
